originalTitle: Nigerian court orders UK to pay £420m over 1949 killing of miners
title: Nigerian court orders UK to pay £420m over 1949 killing of miners
content: The colonial police, made up of Nigerians and Europeans, shot dead workers striking for better conditions.

originalTitle: Fisherman fleeing elephants killed by crocodile in Zambia
title: Fisherman fleeing elephants killed by crocodile in Zambia
content: The fisherman ran into a stream near the river after he and two friends encountered a herd of elephants.

originalTitle: Dozens of Muslims 'massacred' in Nigeria for refusing to join jihadists, says governor
title: Dozens of Muslims 'massacred' in Nigeria for refusing to join jihadists, says governor
content: At least 78 bodies have been buried, while there are fears that around 170 people were killed altogether.

originalTitle: Palestine Action-linked remand prisoner Umer Khalid admitted to hospital
title: Palestine Action-linked remand prisoner Umer Khalid admitted to hospital
content: After his heart rate slowed and organs failed due to his hunger strike, Umer Khalid, 22, has been hospitalised again.

originalTitle: ‘Crypto winter’: Why is Bitcoin crashing despite Trump’s support?
title: ‘Crypto winter’: Why is Bitcoin crashing despite Trump’s support?
content: Bitcoin has been on a downward spiral since last October as the 'hype' over crypto wanes.

originalTitle: Iranian, US officials meet separately with Omani mediator
title: Iranian, US officials meet separately with Omani mediator
content: The Iranian and US delegations to indirect talks in Oman met separately with the country’s foreign minister.

originalTitle: More than 30 killed in blast at Pakistan mosque, officials say
title: More than 30 killed in blast at Pakistan mosque, officials say
content: Almost 170 were injured in the explosion, which took place during Friday prayers in the capital Islamabad.

originalTitle: US and Iran hold talks as fears of direct conflict continue
title: US and Iran hold talks as fears of direct conflict continue
content: The US has built up its military presence in the Middle East in response to Iran's violent crackdown on protests.

title: Russian general shot several times in Moscow
content: Lt Gen Vladimir Alexeyev is a senior figure in the main directorate of Russia's military general staff.

originalTitle: From £70 a week to brink of Premier League record 24 years later
title: From £70 a week to brink of Premier League record 24 years later
content: James Milner will equal the Premier League appearance record if he features for Brighton on Sunday, 24 years after making his debut as a 16-year-old.

originalTitle: 'Football aspect of Liverpool season not so important after Jota'
title: 'Football aspect of Liverpool season not so important after Jota'
content: Former Liverpool goalkeeper Caoimhin Kelleher says performances and results at his old club are not quite as important this season following the death of Diogo Jota.

originalTitle: Why should I not express how I feel? - Guardiola
title: Why should I not express how I feel? - Guardiola
content: Pep Guardiola defended his stance of speaking up about global conflicts by asking, "why should I not express what I feel, just because I am a manager?"
